00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::ProblemRenderer - renderViaXMLRPC is an HTML 
00020 front end for calls to the xmlrpc webservice
00021 
00022 =cut
00023 
00024 use strict;
00025 use warnings;
00026 
00027 package WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::renderViaXMLRPC;
00028 use base qw(WeBWorK::ContentGenerator);
00029 
00030 #use Crypt::SSLeay;
00031 #use XMLRPC::Lite;
00032 #use MIME::Base64 qw( encode_base64 decode_base64);
00033 
00034 
00035 use strict;
00036 use warnings;
00037 use WebworkClient;
00038 
00039 
00040 =head1 Description
00041 
00042 
00043 #################################################
00044   renderViaXMLRPC -- a front end for the Webservice that accepts HTML forms
00045 
00046   receives WeBWorK problems presented as HTML forms,
00047   packages the form variables into an XML_RPC request
00048  suitable for the Webservice/RenderProblem.pm
00049  takes the answer returned by the webservice (which has HTML format) and 
00050  returns it to the browser.
00051 #################################################
00052 
00053 =cut
00054  
00055 # To configure the target webwork server two URLs are required
00056 # 1. $XML_URL   http://test.webwork.maa.org/mod_xmlrpc
00057 #    points to the Webservice.pm and Webservice/RenderProblem modules
00058 #    Is used by the client to send the original XML request to the webservice
00059 #
00060 # 2. $FORM_ACTION_URL      http:http://test.webwork.maa.org/webwork2/html2xml
00061 #    points to the renderViaXMLRPC.pm module.
00062 #
00063 #     This url is placed as form action url when the rendered HTML from the original
00064 #     request is returned to the client from Webservice/RenderProblem. The client
00065 #     reorganizes the XML it receives into an HTML page (with a WeBWorK form) and 
00066 #     pipes it through a local browser.
00067 #
00068 #     The browser uses this url to resubmit the problem (with answers) via the standard
00069 #     HTML webform used by WeBWorK to the renderViaXMLRPC.pm handler.  
00070 #
00071 #     This renderViaXMLRPC.pm handler acts as an intermediary between the browser 
00072 #     and the webservice.  It interprets the HTML form sent by the browser, 
00073 #     rewrites the form data in XML format, submits it to the WebworkWebservice.pm 
00074 #     which processes it and sends the the resulting HTML back to renderViaXMLRPC.pm
00075 #     which in turn passes it back to the browser.
00076 # 3.  The second time a problem is submitted renderViaXMLRPC.pm receives the WeBWorK form 
00077 #     submitted directly by the browser.  
00078 #     The renderViaXMLRPC.pm translates the WeBWorK form, has it processes by the webservice
00079 #     and returns the result to the browser. 
00080 #     The The client renderProblem.pl script is no longer involved.
00081 # 4.  Summary: renderProblem.pl is only involved in the first round trip
00082 #     of the submitted problem.  After that the communication is  between the browser and
00083 #     renderViaXMLRPC using HTML forms and between renderViaXMLRPC and the WebworkWebservice.pm
00084 #     module using XML_RPC.
00085 
00086 
00087 # Determine the root directory for webwork on this machine (e.g. /opt/webwork/webwork2 )
00088 # this is set in webwork.apache2-config
00089 # it specifies the address of the webwork root directory
00090 
00091 #my $webwork_dir  = $ENV{WEBWORK_ROOT};
00092 my $webwork_dir  = $WeBWorK::Constants::WEBWORK_DIRECTORY;
00093 unless ($webwork_dir) {
00094     die "renderViaXMLRPC.pm requires that the top WeBWorK directory be set in ".
00095     "\$WeBWorK::Constants::WEBWORK_DIRECTORY by webwork.apache-config or webwork.apache2-config\n";
00096 }
00097 
00098 # read the webwork2/conf/global.conf file to determine other parameters
00099 #
00100 my $seed_ce = new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({ webwork_dir => $webwork_dir });
00101 my $server_root_url = $seed_ce->{server_root_url};
00102 unless ($server_root_url) {
00103     die "unable to determine apache server url using course environment |$seed_ce|.".
00104         "check that the variable \$server_root_url has been properly set in conf/global.conf\n";
00105 }
00106 
00107 ############################
00108 # These variables are set when the child process is started
00109 # and remain constant through all of the calls handled by the 
00110 # child
00111 ############################
00112 
00113 our ($XML_URL,$FORM_ACTION_URL, $XML_PASSWORD, $XML_COURSE);
00114 
00115     $XML_PASSWORD        =  'xmlwebwork';
00116     $XML_COURSE          =  'daemon_course';
00117 
00118 
00119 
00120     $XML_URL             =  "$server_root_url/mod_xmlrpc";
00121     $FORM_ACTION_URL     =  "$server_root_url/webwork2/html2xml";
00122 
00123 use constant DISPLAYMODE   => 'images'; #  jsMath  is another possibilities.
00124 
00125 
00126 our @COMMANDS = qw( listLibraries    renderProblem  ); #listLib  readFile tex2pdf 
00127 
00128 
00129 ##################################################
00130 # end configuration section
00131 ##################################################

00134 sub pre_header_initialize {
00135     my ($self) = @_;
00136     my $r = $self->r;
00137  
00138     my %inputs_ref;
00139     my @keys = $r->mutable_param;  # $r->param;
00140     foreach my $key ( @keys ) {
00141         $inputs_ref{$key} = $r->param("$key");
00142     }
00143     my $user_id      = $inputs_ref{userID};
00144     my $session_key  = $inputs_ref{session_key};
00145     my $courseName   = $inputs_ref{courseID};
00146 
00147     #######################
00148     #  setup xmlrpc client
00149     #######################
00150     my $xmlrpc_client = new WebworkClient;
00151 
00152     $xmlrpc_client->{encodedSource}   = $r->param('problemSource') ; # this source has already been encoded
00153     $xmlrpc_client->url($XML_URL);
00154     $xmlrpc_client->{form_action_url} = $FORM_ACTION_URL;
00155     $xmlrpc_client->{displayMode}     = DISPLAYMODE();
00156     $xmlrpc_client->{userID}          = $inputs_ref{userID};
00157 #   $xmlrpc_client->{password}        = $XML_PASSWORD;
00158     $xmlrpc_client->{session_key}     = $inputs_ref{session_key};
00159     $xmlrpc_client->{courseID}        = $inputs_ref{courseID};
00160     
00161 
00162     $xmlrpc_client->{inputs_ref} = \%inputs_ref;
00163     # print STDERR WebworkClient::pretty_print($r->{paramcache});
00164     
00165     ##############################
00166     # xmlrpc_client calls webservice to have problem rendered
00167     #
00168     # and stores the resulting HTML output in $self->{output}
00169     # from which it will eventually be returned to the browser
00170     #
00171     ##############################
00172     if ( $xmlrpc_client->xmlrpcCall('renderProblem', $xmlrpc_client->{inputs_ref}) )    {
00173         $self->{output} = $xmlrpc_client->formatRenderedProblem;
00174     } else {
00175         $self->{output} = $xmlrpc_client->{output};  # error report
00176     }
00177     
00178     ################################
00179  }
00180 
00181 sub content {
00182    ###########################
00183    # Return content of rendered problem to the browser that requested it
00184    ###########################
00185     my $self = shift;
00186     print $self->{output};
00187 }
